title: Permanent bans
body:
Alright so I got permanently banned on my old account ''Poopity786'' after 2 games of toxicity. Back then I never understood how the system worked and assumed that I had deserved it although I was bummed about losing the hundreds I had spent on it. Fast forward 2 years later and I became curious to how the permaban system worked because of some boards i stumbled upon. Soon I realized that while many of the people on the boards had logs that were fairly toxic and had multiple warnings, I saw that my chat logs were not at all as toxic as my punishment would perceive. While I had only received a single 2 week warning before my permanent ban, several others had received plenty even though they had said worse. I've been informed that the worst word you could use in the game is ''kys'', however the worst I said was ''stfu''. Sure that type of language is unacceptable and I agree that I should've received my punishment to the extent of the language I used, but a permaban? After a while I'm starting to wonder if my permaban is really justified. Here are my chat logs.

I was definitely toxic, but after only 1 warning, the first game a 2 week ban, and then the second permanent ban, I think I really should not have been permanently banned. My teammates and the opposing team in both games appeared to be just as toxic if not more and yet I was the only player banned. I hope that my permanent banned was invalid and I get to play on this account once more as a reformed, new player. If I'm wrong my apologies as I was definitely a toxic player.

replies.body:
> My teammates and the opposing team in both games appeared to be just as toxic if not more and yet I was the only player banned

They are responsible for their actions. You are responsible for your actions.

> as a reformed, new player

You are not reformed. Nothing you said in either of those games contributed to the game. Everything was badgering, belittling, and berating your teammates. You can't declare "I'm reformed, no really" and have chat logs like that. Stop typing and play the game.

> [{quoted}](name=GatekeeperTDS,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=lqmdTVsW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-06-01T05:20:30.563+0000)
>
> They are responsible for their actions. You are responsible for your actions.
> 
> You are not reformed. Nothing you said in either of those games contributed to the game. Everything was badgering, belittling, and berating your teammates. You can't declare "I'm reformed, no really" and have chat logs like that. Stop typing and play the game.

He did say its 2 years ago, people change in that time for better or worse, how can you tell if he is reformed or not?

Because he's downplaying how bad his chat logs were, and in another reply to me said:

> I was a fairly positive during the time I used the account and I'm sure I did not deserve this

No he was not, and yes he did.

People who were truly reformed will understand that they have to work within the confines of the rules. This isn't a negotiation. Riot gets to set the standards, and after going through the punishment tiers, he continued being toxic until he lost that original account. Now he wants it back "because it wasn't all that bad and I've seen worse."

Not reformed.

These were my only 2 offenses before I was permanently banned. Go ahead and say that's invalid if you don't believe me. No chat restrictions, no 1 week ban, no 1 day ban. 2 games was all it took. 2 week ban, to permanent ban. I was also honor level 4 on Poopity786. Im not going to go as far as to say that i was the most positive player or a positive player, but you don't get level 4 honors from being toxic. I was as plain and respectful as it gets. 2 years later and im honor level 4 once more and not a single offense. If you don't call that reformed then your standards are definitely too high.

There is no such thing as a 1 week ban, or a 1 day ban. There never has been. The system was infinitely scaling chat restrictions (and manual permanent bans), then changed to the current one.

If you skipped to a 2 week ban off the bat, it is because you were **so toxic** as to deserve escalation and skipping punishments.

Further, it does not matter if you are reformed now - you were given your chances and warnings and blew them on that account.
Where do you see in the two logs for the games that made me deserving of 1 warning until a permanent ban.
These are your permanent ban chat logs, not your 2 week ban chat logs. Your 2 week ban chat logs were what was so severe to merit only getting that one warning.
How do i see those logs

You can try asking support for them - but given that it's been two years, I'm not sure if they will give them to you.

You were given those logs when you got the 2 week ban - it sounds to me like you ignored them and just moved on for 2 weeks then came back.

All I have to offer you is my word, but trust me, after spending hundreds on that account, receiving a permanent ban was the last thing I would've wanted. Knowing myself I would've been more careful after receiving a 2 week ban knowing a permanent was coming. But that's another thing, How come I was not notified that the 2 week ban was my last warning. Who knows maybe I was but skipped over the notification, but I'm sure I read every last word on the 2 week ban notice. Even if we've been toxic, players who have knowledge of the ban system should be notified of their warnings and chances before the permanent ban.
You can be "pretty sure", but the ban notice is the same for everyone. The last sentence states explicitly that it's your last chance.

> I was as plain and respectful as it gets.

Your repeated insistence on this when your chat logs say otherwise is quite amusing.

If your first punishment was a 2-week ban, then that was most likely due to dropping a zero-tolerance phrase, the most popular examples among toxic players being homophobic slurs, racial slurs, and encouraging self harm.

Once you get to the 2-week ban, no matter how you got there, **the next punishment is a permanent ban**.

What I or anyone here thinks is irrelevant. Even if I agreed with you that your punishment was invalid (I don't), Riot gets to determine that. Ask them to unban your account and let us know how it goes. I'd be interested to see a case where they actually screwed up.
What in both of the chat logs did you see there that was 0 tolerance. Also other than these 2 offenses, I've had no other run ins with the system and continued to play accordingly.
No, no. Your **first** punishment, the two-week ban that came before the permanent ban.

I didn't receive logs for my 2 week ban lmao. What's up with that? Also the words I used that would be considered toxic such as ''stfu'', ''autism'', and ''r%%%%%ed'' were what gave me my permanent ban. Ill take responsibility for saying those words as they are definitely toxic but if they warranted a permanent ban or a 2 week ban, half of league's players would be in their 2 week ban or perm banned. My brother has had his account for about 5 years and has been as toxic as I was in those 2 games for the entire time, yet he hasn't even been issued a 2 week ban. Hmmm.

I don't think you read the part where I said this was 2 years ago. I am currently playing on a new account and I am honor level 4 bordering 5. I've been a positive member of the community as far as I'm concerned and once again, I am taking responsibility. I agree that I should've been punished, but a permanent ban after only 1 warning? The worst I had said was ''stfu'' and I'm sure that while it warrants some type of punishment, that definitely shouldn't warrant a permanent ban after 1 warning. I was a fairly positive during the time I used the account and I'm sure I did not deserve this.

> Poopity786: im following rules

> Poopity786: you are so r%%%%%ed that it hurts

Lol.
Those were both within the same game where I was banned. Once again, I was toxic, but that language does not warrant a permanent ban im sure.

Riot told you it was worth a permanent ban...by giving you a permanent ban.

The system does not go by "X action = Y punishment." Once you go through all of the punishment tiers, your next punishment, regardless of the severity of your chat logs, is a permanent ban. There's no negotiation, man.

Im not hoping for my ban to be lifted and negotiate. If the ban was justified oh well. But what im looking for is if it was invalid as my ban seemed fairly absurd. I had 1 warning. 1 warning and thats it.

You got multiple warnings, including a clear final warning that you will be permanently banned for any further infraction. Bans are reserved for people like you, who are so full of themselves they cant understand what consequences or responsibility are. It is not a matter or what you do at that point, if you got that far, nobody deserves you in their game.

I believe there is even a box where you are forced to manually type in your agreement to the final warning..

There is no endless free pass for "i made an attempt" in the real world, especially after multiple failures.
Lmao read the thread and my body paragraph again it seems you're confused.

Feel free to elaborate. It seems _you_ are confused: you strangely assumed that rules and warnings do not apply to you.

Turns out they do.

I have a proposal you might like - what if there was a reform program where a permabanned player's account is unbanned after a year, but the IFS is strict and will issue a true permaban when they get punished.

A true test of reform if you ask me
Seems fair to me
